subject: Re: [junit] @After method is called even if @Before fails on exception
msgSnippet: ... A setup can consist of more than one step. If the third step fails you still want to tear down the first two. Therefor @After is called and you have to
messageBody:
ayeletyuli2 schrieb:
>
> I would expect that if setup fails (i.e., @Before) than teardown
> should not be called. Since teardown expects the initial setup to do
> its job.

A setup can consist of more than one step. If the third step fails
you still want to tear down the first two. Therefor @After is called
and you have to find out for yourself if the specific teardown
is really necessary or not.


Regards, Lothar
